Polls close at 7 p.m. on Tuesday. Hereâ€™s the information you need to cast your ballot.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Have you voted yet? Tomorrow is the last day to return your ballot or to vote in person.

Vote in person at any Voter Service & Polling Location (VSPC) in your county. You can also register to vote, replace a spoiled ballot, and receive assistance. If you are in line by 7 p.m. you can still register and cast a ballot — don't get out of line!

Here's a list of acceptable IDs for in person voting: license or state ID, passport, utility bill, bank statement, or paycheck. If you don't have these forms of ID you may sign an affidavit attesting to your identity.

It is too late to return your ballot by mail through the United States Postal Service. Postmarks do not count. Instead, return your ballot to any VSPC in the county in which you are registered, or bring it to a drop box anywhere in the state.

Find drop box and Voters Service & Polling Centers (VSPCs).

Questions or need for assistance? Call the Just Vote hotline at 866-OUR-VOTE or 88-VE-Y-VOTA (Spanish), or text your questions to 720-710-1661.

Your vote can make the difference. Vote like your rights depend on it.

ACLU of Colorado

Just Vote! Colorado Election Protection is a non-partisan voter assistance project and is not affiliated with or promoting any party, candidate, or ballot issue.
